headline.main: Front and Center, a Commander Faces the Media

lead_paragraph: For more than five weeks, Gen. Tommy R. Franks has led the war on terrorism in Afghanistan. Today, the lanky artilleryman with a chestful of medals faced a new challenge: taking the public stage to rally the country behind the campaign. In his official Washington debut, General Franks, the head of the United States Central Command, met with lawmakers on Capitol Hill and joined Defense Secretary Donald H. Rumsfeld for the first time at a Pentagon news conference.
abstract: Gen Tommy R Franks, head of United States Central Command who is leading war in Afghanistan, conducts his first Pentagon press briefing, answering questions deftly but without straying from scripted answers; photo (M)
